result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Rowsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  To commence forthwith.
  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work.  Court objects to ES.

Provide DNA sample.
Fine of $600.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges. To be paid from bail.  Balance by 5/6/16 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
-------------------
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law including THC tickets, maintains valid driver's license and removes tint on car windows.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R Rowsey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from the defendant or surety. JM
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 40 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply  for work. Court objects to ES. Sentence to commence Forthwith. 

Fine of $600.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and  DNA surcharges to be paid from bail and balance  by 5-6-16 or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample.

Court will consider motion for expungement  if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, including THC tickets,  maintains valid driver's license and removes tint on car windows. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney  Reyna Morales for  Francisco Araiza.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed. court is jury trial . Case remains on for jury trial.
Court ordered case adjourned for  final pretrial on 2-4-16 at 8:30 and jury trial in Branch 47

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdrew bench warrant, but ordered $100.00 cash bond forfeited.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 47. All motion to be filed in court at lease one week prior to the motion date.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Pretrial Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andrew R Rowsey in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-31-2015 at 01:30pm
